headline: Scrutiny Reveals a Rise in Anti-Semitic Crimes
abstract: Attacks have been traditionally underreported, but fighting the scourge in hate crimes begins with better data, experts say.
lead_paragraph: When slurs were spray-painted on a kosher market in West Los Angeles, it was classified by law enforcement as an anti-Semitic hate crime. But when a swastika was carved into a park picnic table or spray-painted on a stop sign, it was classified as an anti-religious hate crime.
